questiontext.text:
We see that in calculating the quotient that the moduli \(r\) and \(t\) divide whilst the arguments \(\text{arg}(z)=\theta\) and \(\text{arg}(w)=\phi\) subtract.

Key Point

If \(z=r(\cos\theta +i\sin\theta )\) and \(w=t(\cos\phi +i\sin\phi )\) then \[zw=rt(\cos (\theta +\phi)+i\sin (\theta + \phi ))\qquad {z\over w}={r\over t}(\cos (\theta -\phi) +i\sin (\theta -\phi ))\]

We conclude that addition and subtraction are most easily carried out in Cartesian form whereas multiplication and division are most easily carried out in polar form.
